bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 182 (Thursday, November 14, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. FLETCHER:H.R. 5089.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8``lay and collect taxes, duties, imposts and excises, topay the debts and provide for the common defense and generalwelfare of the United States.''[Page H8879]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Alternative Fuel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2019

This bill extends and phases out the tax credit for alternative fuels used as a motor fuel, including compressed, liquefied, and renewable natural gas. It provides for a credit equal to the product of (1) 50 cents and the number of gallons of alternative fuel used in certain vehicles before January 1, 2025, and (2) 25 cents for 2025 through 2026. The credit terminates after 2026. The bill also extends outlay payments of such credit through 2026.

bill.title: Alternative Fuel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2019

item.title: Alternative Fuel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2019
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the credit for alternative fuels.
Alternative Fuel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
